intro: Chloraea kraenzliniana, commonly known as the velvetleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers. The plant has velvety, hairy leaves that give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
